title: JAM Session _118 Automated Orientation Registration.pdf
docSource: pdf file uploaded by the user.
pageContent: © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Presented by  Gina Floyd, MSSW, MACCM, Shorter University  May 27-30, 2015  Automated Orientation Registration  Jenzabar’s Annual Meeting  May 27 - 30, 2015 Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center  Nashville, TN © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Background     Shorter University  •   Private, 4-year Liberal Arts college  •   350-400 new students each fall  •   30-50 new students each spring     Orientation  •   Required for all new freshmen and transfers  •   4 Freshman sessions and 1 transfer session in July  •   1 combined session in August and January  •   Freshman schedules created and transfer advisors assigned prior to orientation     Previously used VisualZen (VZ) © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Online registration: Students register online from our own portal     Easily accessible report: Our IT department built a report that grants easy access to and organizes the information from the online registration forms  •   Can be pulled at any time and is cumulative  •   In Excel format, so it can be edited, shared, and prepared easily  •   Imports info from Jenzabar as well as from students’ online entries     Daily email summary: New entries and updated session count  What is Automated Registration? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Sample Online Form – Part 1 © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Sample Online Form – Part 2 © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Basic biographical  •   Imported from Jenzabar  •   Able to be updated online     First generation college student  Information We Gather - Personal © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Freshman/Transfer status     Major     Undeclared interest     Other scheduling considerations     Previous college credit     Transcripts submitted     Foreign language interest     Athletic team     Musical interest     Freshman Learning Community interest  Information We Gather - Academic © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Orientation session date     T shirt size     Number of guests     Special needs  Information We Gather – Orientation Session © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Excel format     Each piece of data collected is a column     Accessed through Scholar (online portal) or Jenzabar link     Data is cumulative     Additional information not on online form included on report:  •   ACT/SAT test scores  •   Predictive GPA  •   Shorter email address  •   Submission number  •   Submission date  About the Report © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Orientation session attendance     Freshman scheduling  •   Major  •   MAT/ENG placement  •   Sports enrollment  •   Learning Community choice  •   Special needs/requests     Transfer & freshman advisor assignment     Escalating transcript evaluation     Verification of major     Conditional Admit tracking     Quick access to number of majors entering  How We Use the Report © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Office of Information Technology  •   Created & updates online form and report  •   Handles troubleshooting     Admissions  •   Directs students to the report (incentives, too)  •   Is call-in contact for students with questions  •   Communicates changes to entered student data     Student Affairs  •   Uses report for orientation planning     Academic Advising  •   Uses report for scheduling  •   Uses report for tracking  Who is Involved? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Easy to Use  •   Registration form pulls information from Jenzabar  •   Students use same portal they use throughout their time at Shorter, and it is the same portal for housing information  •   Staff working with tools they already use regularly     Easy to Access  •   Reports can be run at any time.  •   Reports can be accessed by a variety of staff members.     Easy to Update  •   Yearly changes are simple to communicate and make  •   In-use changes are accessible and immediate  •   Call-in changes are shared inter-departmentally  Why? Part 1 © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     One stop info spot  •   Jenzabar information is merged with newly entered information  •   Report is customizable, so it can be used for multiple purposes     Savings  •   Shorter has saved over $5000/year since we have used this system  •   Frustration and time used in communicating needed updates have been reduced  •   Extraneous information and accessing multiple data sources to gather all information needed has been eliminated  Why? Part 2 © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Need  •   How are you gathering the information now?  •   Is that working?     Staff support  •   Do you have the staff needed to create these forms and reports?  •   Will staff feel comfortable using them?  •   Can the needed departments work together?     Information needed  •   What information do you want to gather from students before orientation?  •   What information do you already have that you want to see?  What Should You Consider? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.  Automated Orientation Registration: Q & A  Questions? © 2015 Jenzabar, Inc.     Contact:  •   Noah Huckaby – IT Business Analyst –   nhuckaby@shorter.edu  •   SQL to create custom tables and stored procedure available upon request.  •   Gina Floyd – Director of Student Engagement and Success –  gfloyd@shorter.edu     Survey (available on laptops in the Universe Room):  https://www.jenzabarevents.com/jam/session_survey.cfm  Additional Resources
